description.narrative: SanitationPriority countries have strengthened capacities to accelerate annual reduction rates for open defecation, which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Every Child to Live in a Clean and Safe Environment By 2021, UNICEF supported countries apply relevant policies, innovative approaches and evidence, to design and implement publicly and privately funded development and humanitarian interventions at scale, that enable Every Child to Live in a Clean and Safe Environment

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House 3 United Nations Plaza New York New York 10017 USA

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: SanitationPriority countries have strengthened capacities to accelerate annual reduction rates for open defecation

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF focused on the learnings from theGame Plan to End Open Defecationand started to pivot towards a newGame Plan for Sanitationwhich pivots to safely managed sanitation through SDG accelerators. Several countries were supported in capturing their experiences during the SP period. Several workshops were held throughout 2021 sharing experiences from country offices and gathering inputs on the design of the newGame Plan. Also in 2020, we published aState of the World&39;s Sanitationreport and in 2021 theState of the World’s Hand Hygienereport for high level advocacy and sharing good practice. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/02/2022

title.narrative: Number of priority countries that are reporting on ending open defecation (as outlined in the Gameplan)(55643)
